data.description:
Treekeepers is about a giant tree that needs saving and a hot air balloon at the disposal of you and your 4-person crew. Along the way, encounter oversized obstacles and pests that are out to stop you. One player flies, one player defends the aircraft, and the others kill the bad guys.

Don't like who's flying? Then take the flight stick from them! But you'd better learn to work together quickly, because it's your team vs. the world.

changelog.change_log:
Treekeepers Graphics Update 1.2.04!

New!
Enhanced shadows for most objects (using AI-generated bump maps)
Texture tile randomizer (medium graphics quality and up)
Sunset and Sunrise lighting color effects


Fixed:
Music tracks incorrectly updating at night

1.2.01:
Fixes: 
Fixed teleport ray material glitch
Fixed issue with upgrade bubbles spawning way too high

Changes:
Changed how teleport works (body to teleport point instead of playspace center to teleport point)
Moved tutorial to world select

1.2:
Features:
New enemy spawning logic
Power, metal, and energy upgrades for the engine station
New health spawns around each world
Small world improvements/updates

Fixes:
Upgrade presents always spawn in line of site
Minor network fixes

1.1:
Features:
A full new world, more that doubling the amount of treekeeping to do featuring:
	-New physics-based objectives
	-New music and effects
	-More game attributes changed by the dynamic difficulty system
	-Beautiful new scenery and hand-crafted artwork.
A new high score system!

Fixes:
Several performance improvements for Quest
Several network fixes and netcode improvements

1.0.11
Features:
Added more objects to the world for visual interest and cover from enemies
Added a smooth/continuous locomotion option to the main settings and watch settings

Fixes:
Fixed an issue where some headsets had the wrong saved floor height adjustment, and added a readout in the settings menu to see it
1.0.09: Locks all users to the USW region and adds a connecting status spinner.

1.0.08
Features:
Added support for more interaction profiles (Windows MR package install, added windows motion controller and khronos simple controller interaction profiles to OpenXR)

1.0.07
Features: 
Added a wind effect to blow players off the top of the Ferris wheel when the objective is done

Fixes: 
Fixed some objective spawn issues
Fixed issue where “trap” objectives were not properly triggered by ship crush kills
Fixed issue where “trap” objectives could remain permanently closed
Added failsafe code for “trap” objectives to undo after set period of time
Fixed issue with hands sometimes not showing on SteamVR

1.0.05
Features:
New Difficulty Calc

Fixes
Some rendering issues on second stage
Enemy crushing was not registering enemy spawner countdowns

1.0.04
New features:
Ability to leave a review, End of game voice and music fade

Version 1.0.02 &1.0.03

Fixes
Fix for network sync of ridable object states
Mobile-performant shader for transparent ship windows to improve performance looking down

Version 1.0.01

New features:
Refined Difficulty System
New helpful voice lines
Compass on ground & Ship tweaks

Fixes:
Fixed network issues related to health and upgrades not clearing when leaving a game

Version 0.1.88

New features:
Ability to quit from a game with a room full of people
New tutorial items and explanatory voice lines
Refined enemy behavior

Fixes:
Network issues and menu bugs when quitting from a game
Some objective not triggering issues
AppLab VRC fix:  Added check for internet connectivity
Verson 0.1.85 is a bugfix release.  Fixes include network session continuity, performance, and disabling some features on mobile.
